trans-unit.source: Managing access to resources with Azure Active Directory groups| Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Managing access to resources with Azure Active Directory groups| Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: A topic that explains how to use groups for access management in Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: A topic that explains how to use groups for access management in Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: Managing access to resources with Azure Active Directory groups
trans-unit.target: Managing access to resources with Azure Active Directory groups

trans-unit.source: Azure Active Directory is a comprehensive identity and access management solution that provides a robust set of capabilities to manage access to on-premises and cloud applications and resources including Microsoft online services like Office 365 and a world of non-Microsoft SaaS applications.
trans-unit.target: Azure Active Directory is a comprehensive identity and access management solution that provides a robust set of capabilities to manage access to on-premises and cloud applications and resources including Microsoft online services like Office 365 and a world of non-Microsoft SaaS applications.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] To use Azure Active Directory, you need an Azure account.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] To use Azure Active Directory, you need an Azure account.

trans-unit.source: If you don't have an account, you can [sign up for a free Azure account](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/).
trans-unit.target: If you don't have an account, you can [sign up for a free Azure account](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/).

trans-unit.source: Within Azure Active Directory, one of the major features is the ability to manage access to resources.
trans-unit.target: Within Azure Active Directory, one of the major features is the ability to manage access to resources.

trans-unit.source: These resources can be part of the directory, as in the case of permissions to manage objects through roles in the directory, or resources that are external to the directory, such as SaaS applications, Azure services, and SharePoint sites or on premise resources.
trans-unit.target: These resources can be part of the directory, as in the case of permissions to manage objects through roles in the directory, or resources that are external to the directory, such as SaaS applications, Azure services, and SharePoint sites or on premise resources.

trans-unit.source: There are 4 ways a user can be assigned access rights to a resource:
trans-unit.target: There are 4 ways a user can be assigned access rights to a resource:

trans-unit.source: Direct assignment
trans-unit.target: Direct assignment

trans-unit.source: Users can be assigned directly to a resource by the owner of that resource.
trans-unit.target: Users can be assigned directly to a resource by the owner of that resource.

trans-unit.source: Group membership
trans-unit.target: Group membership

trans-unit.source: A group can be assigned to a resource by the resource owner, and by doing so, granting the members of that group access to the resource.
trans-unit.target: A group can be assigned to a resource by the resource owner, and by doing so, granting the members of that group access to the resource.

trans-unit.source: Membership of the group can then be managed by the owner of the group.
trans-unit.target: Membership of the group can then be managed by the owner of the group.

trans-unit.source: Effectively the resource owner delegates the permission to assign users to their resource to the owner of the group.
trans-unit.target: Effectively the resource owner delegates the permission to assign users to their resource to the owner of the group.

trans-unit.source: Rule based
trans-unit.target: Rule based

trans-unit.source: The resource owner can use a rule to express which users should be assigned access to a resource.
trans-unit.target: The resource owner can use a rule to express which users should be assigned access to a resource.

trans-unit.source: The outcome of the rule depends on the attributes used in that rule and their values for specific users, and by doing so, the resource owner effectively delegates the right to manage access to their resource to the authoritative source for the attributes that are used in the rule.
trans-unit.target: The outcome of the rule depends on the attributes used in that rule and their values for specific users, and by doing so, the resource owner effectively delegates the right to manage access to their resource to the authoritative source for the attributes that are used in the rule.

trans-unit.source: Note that the resource owner still manages the rule itself and determines which attributes and values provide access to their resource.
trans-unit.target: Note that the resource owner still manages the rule itself and determines which attributes and values provide access to their resource.

trans-unit.source: External authority
trans-unit.target: External authority

trans-unit.source: The access to a resource is derived from an external source, e.g. a group that is synchronized from an authoritative source such as an on premise directory or a SaaS app such as WorkDay.
trans-unit.target: The access to a resource is derived from an external source, e.g. a group that is synchronized from an authoritative source such as an on premise directory or a SaaS app such as WorkDay.

trans-unit.source: The resource owner assigns the group to provide access to the resource, and the external source manages the members of the group.
trans-unit.target: The resource owner assigns the group to provide access to the resource, and the external source manages the members of the group.

trans-unit.source: Watch a video that explains Access Management
trans-unit.target: Watch a video that explains Access Management

trans-unit.source: You can watch a short video that explains more about this [here](http://channel9.msdn.com/Series/Azure-Active-Directory-Videos-Demos/Azure-AD--Introduction-to-Dynamic-Memberships-for-Groups).
trans-unit.target: You can watch a short video that explains more about this [here](http://channel9.msdn.com/Series/Azure-Active-Directory-Videos-Demos/Azure-AD--Introduction-to-Dynamic-Memberships-for-Groups).

trans-unit.source: How does Access Management in Azure Active Directory work?
trans-unit.target: How does Access Management in Azure Active Directory work?

trans-unit.source: At the center of Azure Active Directory’s access management solution is the security group.
trans-unit.target: At the center of Azure Active Directory’s access management solution is the security group.

trans-unit.source: Using a security group to manage access to resources is a well-known paradigm, which allows for a flexible and easily understood way to provide access to a resource for the intended group of users.
trans-unit.target: Using a security group to manage access to resources is a well-known paradigm, which allows for a flexible and easily understood way to provide access to a resource for the intended group of users.

trans-unit.source: The resource owner (or the administrator of the directory) can assign a group to provide a certain access right to the resources they own.
trans-unit.target: The resource owner (or the administrator of the directory) can assign a group to provide a certain access right to the resources they own.

trans-unit.source: The members of the group will be provided the access, and the resource owner can delegate the right to manage the members list of a group to someone else – such as a department manager or a helpdesk administrator.
trans-unit.target: The members of the group will be provided the access, and the resource owner can delegate the right to manage the members list of a group to someone else – such as a department manager or a helpdesk administrator.

trans-unit.source: The owner of a group can also make that group available for self service requests.
trans-unit.target: The owner of a group can also make that group available for self service requests.

trans-unit.source: In doing so, an end user can search for and find the group and make a request to join, effectively seeking permission to access the resources that are managed through the group.
trans-unit.target: In doing so, an end user can search for and find the group and make a request to join, effectively seeking permission to access the resources that are managed through the group.

trans-unit.source: The owner of the group can set up the group so that join requests are approved automatically or require approval by the owner of the group.
trans-unit.target: The owner of the group can set up the group so that join requests are approved automatically or require approval by the owner of the group.

trans-unit.source: When a user makes a request to join a group, the join request is forwarded to the owners of the group.
trans-unit.target: When a user makes a request to join a group, the join request is forwarded to the owners of the group.

trans-unit.source: If one of the owners approves the request, the requesting user is notified and the user is joined to the group.
trans-unit.target: If one of the owners approves the request, the requesting user is notified and the user is joined to the group.

trans-unit.source: If one of the owners denies the request, the requesting user is notified but not joined to the group.
trans-unit.target: If one of the owners denies the request, the requesting user is notified but not joined to the group.

trans-unit.target: Getting started with access management

trans-unit.source: Ready to get started?
trans-unit.target: Ready to get started?

trans-unit.source: You should try out some of the basic tasks you can do with Azure AD groups.
trans-unit.target: You should try out some of the basic tasks you can do with Azure AD groups.

trans-unit.source: Use these capabilities to provide specialized access to different groups of people for different resources in your organization.
trans-unit.target: Use these capabilities to provide specialized access to different groups of people for different resources in your organization.

trans-unit.source: A list of basic first steps are listed below.
trans-unit.target: A list of basic first steps are listed below.

trans-unit.target: Now that you have understood the basics of access management, here are some additional advanced capabilities available in Azure Active Directory for managing access to your applications and resources.
